meanings.definition: A person who transfers property to another.
meanings.sent1: The alienors signed the deed to give the house to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: The alienors sold the land to the developers last week.
meanings.sent3: The alienors joked about being professional property givers at the party.
meanings.sent4: The alienors were like Santa Claus, passing out deeds instead of gifts.
meanings.sent5: The alienors handed over the keys with a smile, knowing they were helping someone new.

meanings.definition: Those who grant or convey property to another.
meanings.sent1: The alienors transferred ownership of the estate to the heirs.
meanings.sent2: The alienors donated the building to the charity for a good cause.
meanings.sent3: At the auction, the alienors playfully pretended to sell imaginary properties.
meanings.sent4: The alienors were like wizards, magically transferring ownership with a pen.
meanings.sent5: The alienors' generosity in granting properties made them well-known in the community.
